snippet: The significant loss of tourism has taken a disastrous toll on the economy, starving the country of badly needed foreign currency.
abstract: Significant loss of tourism has taken a disastrous toll on Egypt's economy, starving it of badly needed foreign currency; officials say before the 2010 political crisis, almost 15 million foreign tourists visited Egypt; figure fell to 9.5 million in 2013, and most visitors these days are beachgoers who avoid Cairo and other cultural destinations, limiting the reach of the money they spend.
lead_paragraph: The significant loss of tourism has taken a disastrous toll on the economy, starving the country of badly needed foreign currency.

headline.main: Egyptian Tourism’s Message to World: Come Anyway
headline.print_headline: Egyptian Tourism’s Message to World: Come Anyway

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
